title: High contrast extended sans, feedback needed.
content:
Hello Typophile,

I'm working on a piece of lettering with plans of extending it to a full display typeface later.  
I would highly appreciate any professional feedback on this stage.  
(yep i want to stick with such leg for "R"=)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416005751im_/http:/typophile.com/files/mdp_4036.gif)
author: nrcs

comments.content: First, I like it. Second, I'd be glad to help but I don't want spend my time giving bad or incomprehensible explanations. Is it possible for you to provide a sample as PDF or vector in order to easily "modify" your lettering? Third, I'm no professional at all.
@nrcs: Is this a personal, professional, or academic project?

Those gently flaring thin strokes are the best thing about this design, so work that good.

Ryuk, nice to see you on this side. :-)

hhp

@Ryuk: Thank You. Sure. Sorry i'm still not familiar with managing content here, so can i just post a direct link?  
 [https://dl.dropbox.com/u/1688987/MDP/mdp.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416005751/https:/dl.dropbox.com/u/1688987/MDP/mdp.pdf "https://dl.dropbox.com/u/1688987/MDP/mdp.pdf")
@Chris Dean: I'd call it semi-personal work. It's part of a branding project for my fellow fashion designer.
